alert.note: Alert for Coal (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 08 at 1:48PM CDT until June 08 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Atoka and Coal. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 148 PM CDT, Heavy rain due to thunderstorms has already occurred. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coalgate, Stringtown, Wardville, Chockie and Atoka Reservoir. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
